comment: Nose of sweet buttered biscuit and cherry jam. Vanilla and a little caramel on the palate. Clove, bitter, and peppery finish.
Great, smooth and sweet bourbon. Excellent flavor and pop, especially for the price.
very spicy...good with a couple drops of water.

Note: vanilla, orange bitters, sweet pineapple, apple

Palate: vanilla, orange peel, sweet pineapple, sweet cream, amaretto, toasted almond, berries, butterscotch

Mouth: tip of tongue, sides of tongue

Smell: almonds, berries, blueberries, vanilla 
Pallet : oranges, fruity nut flavor, chocolate, hazel wood 

Hits the back or the throat and then the tip of the tongue

$40.00

Nose: vanilla, sweet, fruity, floral, white oak, almonds

Taste: Strong alcohol start that mellows out to a wheat dominant, sweet honey, butterscotch, orange, light wood barrel flavor with a rye light finish and some smoke. It is very full, warm, smoothe, and syrupy.

Placement: Starts in the back roof of my mouth and finishes on my lips.

Nose: Vanilla, berries, crisp apple, floral

Palate: vanilla, cherry, butter and honey with slight orange

hits slightly the tip of the tongue and sides goes down really smooth

Cookie sweetness, light vanilla floral on the nose. Oak and tannin spice then corn sweetness and vanilla. Medium light body. Long spicy finish which is odd for a mashbill without rye. High proof is a little hot, but... an interesting wheated bourbon.

Light grain aroma
Smooth mellow body, medium
Grain flavor, spice kick after blends with the tail and tingles together with the alcohol
Approachable and well balanced.

Inhale lightly and your nose will be filled with the scent of peanut butter. The first impression on the tongue is doughy peanut butter cookie followed by pepper and finishing with nutmeg and clove. Not a long finish. Seems just a tad green. It makes me wonder what this would be like after a couple more years in the barrel. All in all not a bad whiskey.
Buy buy buy, velvety smooth with some spice
Nose: big on vanilla; Palate: big on oak; Finish: decent medium length. At $123 at the SAQ in Quebec, it’s expensive for a NAS Bourbon

I stood in line to get one of the first bottles they ever released and opened it when I found out my wife was pregnant with our first son! What a glorious bottle of bourbon. Has the same wheat characteristics of their whiskey but very smooth and full flavored. Absolutely recommend!
smooth, vanilla start, touch of rye taste at the back
